oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Discussion - Bob Dylan: Blonde On Blonde recording sessions in Nashville - 2017-07-15
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Panel discussion titled “Is It Rolling, Bob?”: Bob Dylan’s Nashville Recordings Revisited. Moderated by Pete Finney. Participants are author and Princeton University history professor Sean Wilentz, guitarist Wayne Moss, multi-instrumentalist Charlie McCoy and songwriter Robyn Hancock. In support of the exhibition titled Dylan, Cash, and the Nashville Cats: A New Music City.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Pete Finney; Sean Wilentz; Wayne Moss; Charlie McCoy; Robyn Hancock;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Opening comments by Michael Gray begin in progress / (00:55) Introduction of Sean Wilentz / (03:40) Sean's opening comments / (04:09) Sean talks about the year 1966, Bob Dylan's influences and why he went to Nashville / (07:03) Dylan trying to follow up the success of the recording of Like A Rolling Stone and his unhappiness with recording in New York with The Hawks / (08:44) Producer Bob Johnston brings Dylan to Nashville and the influence of Charlie McCoy on that decision / (09:24) Manager Albert Grossman's hesitation to let Dylan come to Nashville / (09:48) Bringing Al Kooper to Nashville and his background / (10:53) Dylan's first recordings in Nashville / (11:20) Stories about Dylan finishing song lyrics while the musicians wait and other recording stories / (14:27) Other artists coming to Nashville because of Dylan's success / (15:07) Makes supposition about the arch of the Nashville recordings in Dylan's mind by talking about the song Leopard Skin Pillbox Hat /

(16:26) Plays recording of Lightning Hopkins' Automobile Blues / (17:33) Plays recording of the first takes of Leopard Skin Pillbox Hat by Dylan / (18:59) Sean comments on the comparisons of the two songs / (19:24) Plays the Nashville third take of Leopard Skin Pillbox Hat / (20:55) Sean talks about this Nashville take leading into takes four and five and plays recording of takes four and five of the Nashville version of Leopard Skin Pillbox Hat / (22:51) Talks about coming back to the song Leopard Skin Pillbox Hat on the last day of recording / (23:11) Plays recording of the final take of Leopard Skin Pillbox Hat / (26:25) Other participants join Sean on stage introduced by Michael Gray / (28:06) Introduction of moderator Pete Finney / (29:23) Opening comments from Pete / (30:25) Pete talks about the importance of Dylan's Blonde On Blonde album to the Nashville recording scene to both Dylan and Nashville /
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Wilentz, Sean; Finney, Pete; McCoy, Charlie, 1941-; Moss, Wayne; Hancock, Robyn; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
